text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hobbit Tasting. Pale yellow colour with no head. Aroma is rice, some grains, mild pear, some avocado and mild earthy notes. Flavour is toasted, some rice, mild soy like notes along with alcohol and some slight avocado notes.

06.11.2014, 0,375l bottle (batch #5) sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Light straw colored, completely clear. Aroma is mild and balanced, hay, oak, fermented rice, alcohol, flowers, hints of caramel. Taste is slightly sweet mineraly, sugar, hay, alcohol, fermented rice, caramel, grass, oak, minerals. Slightly dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pale yellow crystal clear body. Aroma is wood, vanilla, mild bread yeast, rice, hints of seaweed and mild nuts. Taste is citric tones, mandarine, bread crust, hints of alcohol and rice. Pretty pleasant.
Lys hvitvinsfarve. Lukt av frukt og gjær. Smak av vinøse frukter samt en anelse soppsmak. Søtlig avslutning. Melkebaren.
Klar lys gjennomsiltig farge som hvit vin. Ingen skum. Frisk lukt av drue og noe gjær. Frisk fruktig smak av drue med en anelse gjær i ettersmak.
Shared bottle at Nøgne Ø, Grimstad. The third bottle we tasted. This one was not as good as the others, but still a great sake! Super clean with nice fruityness.

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Clear grape/yellow liquid. Aroma of pear, grain, rice, biscuit and mushrooms. Taste is dry with notes of peat, mushroom, soy and rice. Light bodied with no carbonation.
Stockholm Beer & Whiskey 2012: Stor nötig smak, ganska len doft och en trevlig balans.

Sample at SBWF 2012, Master Class with Kjetil Jikiun.

Clear very light yellow, no head. Fruit and yeast, also notes of rice and some spices. Rather soft.

Shared 350 ml green screwcap bottle at local tasting, thanks to abemorsten. ABV is 19%. Nearly colourless sake, just a faint greenish-yellowish hue. No carbonation. Strong aroma of raw alcohol / bad moonshine, boiled rice and marzipan. Medium sweet flavour, marzipan, mushrooms and rice. At least it is slightly better than the aroma.
Shared bottle at abemorsten. Pours light straw coloured with no head. Very hard to sense any aroma at all, but there is some weak alcohol. Taste is nutty and almond, dry finish.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2012 Small glass from my brothers bottle
Straw yellow. Smells of rise, some wine and yeast. Sweet body,  some alcohol. A bit wineous. Dry on the palate. My first sake, som this is a very guessable score

350 ml bottle at home. Clear, pale straw golden. No head. Yeast, booze, vinuous notes, fermented fruits and eraserhead on the nose. Full bodied with an alcoholic warmth and a syrupy texture. Yeasty, boozy and meaty notes in the mouth. Long, dry, leathery finish. Had it with take-away sushi from Sabi Sushi. Excellent match.

Bottle shared at The Trappist.  Clear yellowish in appearance.  The aroma is interesting, yeasty and acidic with rice and floral notes.  The flavor is not too boozy, with a very interesting acidic yeast character, white wine, and fruitiness.  Medium-bodied with slight acidity and good dryness.  Interesting and tasty.
Bottle. Pours a clear watery pale yellow color with no head. Has a fruity slightly flowery yeasty aroma. Sweetish fruity yeasty flowert flavor. Has a fruity yeasty rice finish.
bottle. Yellow colour with no head. Aroma is rice, alcohol, yeast. Flavour is rice, alcohol, yeast, soya, fruit, spices. Mild easy drinkable sake.

Bottle. A clear one, some yellowish color to the flat body. The aroma starts off quite alcoholic but smoothens out after a minute in the glass. Lots of fruits, mostly apple, with hints of citrus. Fruity, slightly spiced flavor with alcohol and some papery, ricey hints, lasting finish. Warming, full-bodied mouthfeel. A nice one, I find it too warming on the palate, but its nice and tasteful. 101126

Bottle 350ml @ Beer2000
[Courtesy of Beer2000] Pours clear as water with no head. Aroma has notes of rice and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet with an alcohol finish. Texture is oily.

Bottle 350ml.Light unclear light cristal yellow white color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy rice, yeasty, fruity, light alcohol. Flavor is moderate heavy sweet with a average duration, dry finish. Body is medium full, texture is creamy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20100920]

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2011 bottle at home ... crisp clear ... light viscous ... very open ... light floral delicate rice nose ... light soft sily mouth feeel ... again delicate ... soft fruit ... light coconut ... light alcohol in finish...I know i shouldnt keep sake ... but there was some ... and trying along side a few others its clear that this sake is way better ... open floral nose ... light rice ... light alcohol ... light silky oily body ... soft coconut ... really quite lovely
Bottled. A hazy light yellow sake. The aroma has notes of rice and cedarwood. The aroma has notes of rice and cedarwood, leading to a dry alcoholic finish.
Bottle. Clear white body. Sweet fruit, rice and light sweetness in aroma. The flavour is clean, sweet rice, sweet alcohol, fruit and some sweet tobacco. One of the better sakes Ive had.

Bottle courtesy of Beer2000.Pours clear with a hint of yellow, no head.Aroma of alcohol, rice, yeast and apple peel with hints of apricots, sweet almonds and orange.Flavor is sweet rice pudding ,warming alcohol and fruitiness.Full body,no carbonation.Meaty sake.

350 ml bottle. Clear, pale straw yellow body with no head. Aroma is quite strong fruity, like something between citric and green apple, phenol, rice, yeast and smooth pleasant alcoholic. Flavor is quite strong fruity in the same direction as aroma, almost spicy yeast, rice, balanced sweet, mild acidic and warming alcohol. Very smooth and balanced between sweet and acidic with a fine warming alcoholic touch. The body feels almost a bit fat and. eh meatish? Long and fruity aftertaste. Easy to like, easy to drink.

Bottle 35 cl. Pours an almost crystal clear with a tint of yellow. Sweet rice aroma with a tart and yeasty edge. Medium body, sweet and fairly sophisticated rice accents with a tart edge. Quite pleasant. 171110

Clear watery with no head 
Aroma; Clear alcohol and rice aromas, with highnotes of yeast
Flavours; A very elegant taste, rich taste. Alittle short aftertaste.
almost clear watery no head. Dry aroma, faint flowery, alc clearly present but never in the way. Flavor is rice, dark caramel, fruity bittery, yeasty palate is thick
Bottle at MikkellerBAR. Clear watery - no head. Sharpness. wooden. Light sweetness. Minerals. Fruity. Rice. Citrus. Fruity. Nice.

35 cL bottle. Pours pale yellow with no head. Wooden phenolic and rice. Eye burning alcohol presence. Caramelish and sweet rice flavoured. Sweet and slight burning alcohol. Lingering butter caramelish sweet. Smooth phenolic and caramelish finish.

Fresh. Green apples.

(This is not a rating as much as it is my fragmental memory notes)

Head? Nah, there aint none. Hazy very pale body, like unfiltered pear juice. Aroma is like nothing Ive ever tried before. Fruity alcoholic apple juice with milky rice notes. Dry-sweet alcoholic apple juice taste with grainy fruity milky notes. Soft, rounded, hot mouthfeel. Mid-bodied. Sweetish light floral mineraly aftertaste lingers for a long time. Nice, and dangerously drinkable, except for the alcohol, which is a bit overpowering. Tastes like what I might be persuaded traditional rural farmhouse sake tastes like. (0.2l draft at Øl & Mat, Oslo.)
